column4: hi, my new printer icon won't appear each time i try installing a new printer
also i can't add a new workspace
it's like i need re-install UBUNTU
but am afraid, it might wipe out current apps and data
how can i do so without losing data?
can i re-install ubuntu without losing my apps and data??
not really  but you can clone your install
YOu may want to consider having a second partition for /home
You can try saving your /home folder to a usb or buring it...  but the next time you are editing partitions.. create a seperate /home partition
Create seperate home and reinstalling isnt an issue.. it doesnt work quiet the same as windows.. just better
See the link on creating a list of all installed packages..
that is cli mode single user root access.
We strongly advise new users to not do things as root user for a reason..  type man chown in a term for info
all the tools are there.  You just need to learn them.
you can try this.. depending on how bad everything is it may work  http://linuxfud.wordpress.com/2007/02/14/how-to-reset-ubuntugnome-settings-to-defaults-without-re-installing/
